9.Summary: "a good place to build experience for better employers"
9.Pros: The work is simple and pay is frequent. they really latch onto you if you are a good employee; they'll give you weekends off if you want and as many shifts as you'd like. less customers come in colder months
9.Cons: Management really makes or breaks your experience here. My first gen. manager was so awful that I was looking to file a complaint with dept. of labor against him but my new manager is good. Same goes with shift managers. I think some of the shift managers are picked just because the slots need to be filled -> they'll just hang out in the back or go down "to look for something" while leaving you alone at the storefront. Afternoon shift employees are awful; they don't show up on time at least 70% of the time and you'll have to stay until they come. As with any retail job, customers can be awful but people just suck. Choose a good area to work in and you'll run into less of those kinds of people.
